intro: Ophiuros muricatulus, commonly known as the rough sea holly, is a marine flowering plant found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Cymaraceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or rocky substrates, often in shallow tidal zones. Its flowering period typically occurs during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators. Ophiuros muricatulus plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small marine organisms.
